docs.lead_paragraph: A study offers a compelling case for price transparency in helping reel in the nation’s health costs.

headline.main: Given Choice, Parents Pick Cheaper Medical Procedure for Children
headline.print_headline: Given Choice, Parents Pick Cheaper Surgery for Children

docs.abstract: The Upshot; study in Annals of Surgery finds that parents who were asked to decide which form of surgery their child should undergo and told about the price difference tended to select the cheaper option regardless of their insurance or economic situation; offers compelling case for price transparency in helping reel in the nation's $2.8 trillion health care bill.
docs.snippet: A study offers a compelling case for price transparency in helping reel in the nation’s health costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: California's Catholic leadership has filed a federal civil rights complaint over a state requirement that health insurance cover abortions.

docs.lead_paragraph: A consumer group is suing the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services to obtain information used to justify insurance rates in Missouri.

headline.main: Consumer Group Sues Over Missouri Insurance Rates
headline.print_headline: Consumer Group Sues Over Missouri Insurance Rates

docs.lead_paragraph: It's October and in some places, voters are already voting. The latest Associated Press-GfK poll finds those likely to cast a ballot are focused more on the economy than other issues. But that hasn't stopped campaigns from trying to appeal on other topics as well. Here's a look at what voters think on the top issues of the election cycle.

headline.main: AP-GfK Poll: Top Issues in the Midterm Election
headline.print_headline: AP-GfK Poll: Top Issues in the Midterm Election

docs.lead_paragraph: The five wealthiest college football conferences have notified the NCAA of their proposals to provide more benefits to athletes under the new governance model that allows the Atlantic Coast Conference, Big Ten, Big 12, Pac-12 and Southeastern Conference to pass legislation without the support of the other Division I leagues.

headline.main: Pac-12, Big Ten, ACC Notify NCAA of Proposals

docs.lead_paragraph: Emergency manager Kevyn Orr testified in bankruptcy court Wednesday that when he took over Detroit's finances, he found a city with poor services for residents, next to no cash flow and significant neighborhood blight.

headline.main: Manager Orr Testifies in Detroit Bankruptcy Trial
headline.print_headline: Manager Orr Testifies in Detroit Bankruptcy Trial

docs.abstract: President Obama and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will meet at the White House on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: President Obama and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will meet at the White House on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secret Service Director Julia Pierson abruptly resigned Wednesday in the face of multiple revelations of security breaches, bumbling in her agency and rapidly eroding confidence that the president and his family were being kept safe.

headline.main: Secret Service Chief Quits Due to Security Lapses
headline.print_headline: Secret Service Chief Quits Due to Security Lapses

docs.snippet: Secret Service Director Julia Pierson abruptly resigned Wednesday in the face of multiple revelations of security breaches, bumbling in her agency and rapidly eroding confidence that the president and his family were being kept safe.
